name: D2. XOR Break — Game Version
statement:
Alice and Bob are playing a game. The game starts with a positive
integer n, with players taking turns. On each turn of the game, the
following sequence of events takes place: The player having the integer
p breaks it into two integers p_{1} and p_{2}, where 0
lt p_{1}
lt p, 0
lt p_{2}
lt p and p_{1}
oplus p_{2} = p. If no such p_{1}, p_{2} exist, the player loses.
Otherwise, the opponent does either select the integer p_{1} or p_{2}.
The game continues with the selected integer. The opponent will try to
break it. As Alice, your goal is to win. You can execute a maximum of 63
break operations. You have the choice to play first or second. The
system will act for Bob.Here
oplus denotes the bitwise XOR operation.
